workflow.name: Automate website monitoring with GPT-4 Mini, MCP tools & multi-channel alerts
workflow.description:
## How it works
This workflow automatically monitors multiple websites using AI-powered analysis and MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools. The system runs scheduled checks, analyzes website performance and security using browser-tools-mcp and mcp-recon servers, categorizes issues by severity (critical, warning, info), sends appropriate alerts through Slack and email, and logs all findings to Google Sheets for historical tracking and trend analysis.

## Who is this for
DevOps engineers, website administrators, system monitors, digital agencies, and technical teams responsible for maintaining multiple websites. Perfect for organizations that need automated website health monitoring with intelligent analysis, comprehensive security checks, and immediate alerting for critical issues.

## Requirements
- **MCP Servers**: Browser-tools-mcp and mcp-recon servers running locally or remotely
- **OpenAI API**: API key for AI-powered website analysis
- **Google Sheets**: Spreadsheet with "Websites" and "Monitoring Log" sheets
- **Slack Integration**: Slack workspace with webhook or bot token for alerts
- **Email Configuration**: SMTP settings for critical email notifications
- **Environment Variables**: Secure storage for all credentials and endpoints

## How to set up
1. **Install and Configure MCP Servers** - Set up browser-tools-mcp and mcp-recon servers, configure endpoints in environment variables (MCP_BROWSER_TOOLS_URL, MCP_RECON_URL)
2. **Prepare Google Sheets Integration** - Create spreadsheet with "Websites" sheet (URL column) and "Monitoring Log" sheet, set GOOGLE_SHEET_ID environment variable
3. **Configure Notification Systems** - Set up Slack webhook/bot and email SMTP settings, configure SLACK_CHANNEL, ALERT_EMAIL, FROM_EMAIL variables
4. **Customize Monitoring Parameters** - Update Configuration Variables node with your monitoring thresholds, batch sizes, and website lists

## How to customize the workflow
Modify the Configuration Variables node to adjust monitoring thresholds (response times, performance scores), change batch processing sizes, update notification preferences, or add additional websites to monitor. Customize alert severity rules in the Alert Severity Router and modify notification templates in the Slack and Email nodes.

workflow.name: Monitor websites with AI analysis and MCP tools

parameters.html:
=

üö® Critical Website Issue Detected

Website: {{ $json.url }}

Severity: CRITICAL

Issues Detected:

    {{ $json.issues.map(issue => '
  • ' + issue + '
    • ').join('') }}

Performance Metrics:

  • Performance Score: {{ $json.performanceScore }}%
  • Response Time: {{ $json.responseTime }}ms
  • SSL Status: {{ $json.sslStatus || 'Unknown' }}
  • Security Score: {{ $json.securityScore || 'N/A' }}

Generated by n8n MCP Monitoring System at {{ new Date().toISOString() }}
parameters.subject: üö® CRITICAL: Website Issue - {{ $json.url }}

parameters.text: =‚ö†Ô∏è **Website Warning** ‚ö†Ô∏è  **Website:** {{ $json.url }} **Severity:** WARNING **Performance Score:** {{ $json.performanceScore }}% **Response Time:** {{ $json.responseTime }}ms **SSL Status:** {{ $json.sslStatus }}  **Issues Found:** {{ $json.issues.map(issue => '‚Ä¢ ' + issue).join('\n') }}  _Generated by n8n MCP Monitoring System_

=Analyze the following websites for performance and security issues. For each website in the batch:

Websites to analyze:
{{ $json.url }}

Use the available MCP tools to:
1. Run browser-tools-mcp to analyze performance, SEO, and accessibility
2. Run mcp-recon to check SSL certificates and security headers

Based on the analysis, determine the severity level:
- CRITICAL: Site down, SSL expired/invalid, performance score <50%, response time >{{ $('Configuration Variables').item.json.config.monitoring.responseTimeCritical }}ms
- WARNING: SSL expiring within {{ $('Configuration Variables').item.json.config.monitoring.sslExpiryWarningDays }} days, performance score <{{ $('Configuration Variables').item.json.config.monitoring.performanceScoreThreshold }}%, response time >{{ $('Configuration Variables').item.json.config.monitoring.responseTimeWarning }}ms, missing critical security headers
- INFO: Minor issues or optimization suggestions

Return a JSON object for each website with this structure:
{
  "url": "website URL",
  "severity": "critical|warning|info",
  "performanceScore": number (0-100),
  "responseTime": number (milliseconds),
  "sslStatus": "valid|expiring|expired|invalid",
  "securityScore": number (0-100),
  "issues": ["array of specific issues found"],
  "recommendations": ["array of improvement suggestions"]
}

Focus on actionable issues that require immediate attention. Be concise but specific about problems found.

parameters.content:
üìä Google Sheets Configuration

**Sheet 1: "Websites"**
Required Headers:
- url - Website URLs to monitor

**Sheet 2: "Monitoring Log"**
Auto-populated Headers:
- timestamp - Analysis timestamp
- url - Website analyzed
- severity - critical/warning/info
- performanceScore - Performance rating (0-100)
- responseTime - Response time in ms
- sslStatus - SSL certificate status
- securityScore - Security rating (0-100)
- issues - Detected problems
- recommendations - Improvement suggestions

üîó Service Account Permissions:
Grant "Editor" access to your Google Sheets service account

üõ†Ô∏è AI-Powered Website Monitoring System

This workflow monitors multiple websites using AI analysis and MCP tools for comprehensive performance and security monitoring.

‚úÖ **Step 1: Install Required MCP Servers**
- Install browser-tools-mcp for performance analysis
- Install mcp-recon for security and SSL monitoring
- Configure server endpoints in environment variables

‚úÖ **Step 2: Setup Google Sheets Integration**
- Create "Websites" sheet with URL column
- Create "Monitoring Log" sheet for results tracking
- Set GOOGLE_SHEET_ID environment variable

‚úÖ **Step 3: Configure Notifications**
- Set up Slack webhook/bot for alerts
- Configure SMTP settings for email notifications
- Set SLACK_CHANNEL, ALERT_EMAIL, FROM_EMAIL variables

‚úÖ **Step 4: Customize Monitoring Settings**
- Update monitoring thresholds in Configuration Variables
- Add your websites to monitor
- Adjust batch processing and alert severity rules

üß™ **Final Step: Test Complete System**
Trigger manually to verify MCP servers, analysis, and notifications work properly

### üîß Required MCP Servers

### Browser Tools MCP
üìÇ **GitHub:** [AgentDeskAI/browser-tools-mcp](https://github.com/AgentDeskAI/browser-tools-mcp)
üåê **Docs:** [Installation Guide](https://browsertools.agentdesk.ai/installation)

**What it does:** Website performance analysis, SEO scoring, accessibility checks

### MCP Recon
üìÇ **GitHub:** [nickpending/mcp-recon](https://github.com/nickpending/mcp-recon)

**What it does:** SSL certificate validation, security headers, domain analysis


**Installation:**
1. Install Node.js if you haven't already
2. Download both repositories from GitHub
3. Follow each repository's README for setup
4. Start both servers before running this workflow

**Default Server URLs:**
- Browser Tools: http://localhost:8001
- MCP Recon: http://localhost:8002

I help freelancers, consultants, and software creators become the 'AI automation expert' in their local markets by building premium automation solutions for local businesses. As an n8n verified creator, I design sophisticated RAG, Voice and multi-agent systems that solve real business problems.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
